intro: Ferula rutbaensis, commonly known as the Persian cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stem and finely divided leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Ferula rutbaensis is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of aromatic plants and their ecological roles.
